page.title: 09LOCAL FAMILY
page.content: Len Boulton, although moving five times, has always stayed in Apperley. The Boultons are one of the oldest families to live in Apperley and a family tree has evolved around the area. Five families live along the same row of houses in Severn Way. Boultons tend to look alike! Louise Boulton's grandfather came to live in Apperley after World War I when his father was killed so that he and 6 other children could be brought up with family support. Boulton men continued to serve in the forces in World War II. Initially most men were engaged in farming as labourers but now the two fathers of school pupils have found work externally - Louise's at{Smiths {Industries,}Bishop's Cleeve and Susan's at{Dowtys }in Cheltenham.
